definition: see 兔死狗烹[tu4 si3 gou3 peng1]
pinyin: jiao3 tu4 si3 zou3 gou3 peng1

definition: crafty/cunning/sly
variant of 兔[tu4]
rabbit
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
dog/CL:隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]
cooking method/to boil sb alive (capital punishment in imperial China)
lit. to boil the hound once it caught the rabbit (idiom)/fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
lit. the birds are over, the bow is put away (idiom); fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
lit. to kill the donkey when the grinding is done (idiom)/to get rid of sb once he has ceased to be useful
being close to the sovereign can be as perilous as lying with a tiger (idiom)
lit. to nurture a tiger invites calamity/fig. to indulge one's enemy is asking for trouble (idiom)
faithful official
outstanding founding minister (title given to reward loyal general or vassal of new dynasty or state)
a treacherous court official/a minister who conspires against the state
(expr.) hold the feudal overlord and you control his vassals
pinyin: xie2 tian1 zi3 yi3 ling4 zhu1 hou2

definition: to usurp power
to seize the throne
to dismiss military hierarchy using wine cups/cf Song founding Emperor Song Taizu 宋太祖 holds a banquet in 961 and persuades his senior army commanders to go home to their provinces
new emperor, new officials (idiom)/a new chief brings in new aides
pinyin: yi1 chao2 tian1 zi3 yi1 chao2 chen2

definition: (expr.) hold the feudal overlord and you control the whole country
pinyin: xie2 tian1 zi3 yi3 ling4 tian1 xia4

definition: a fine bird chooses a tree to nest in (proverb)/fig. a talented person chooses a patron of integrity
pinyin: liang2 qin2 ze2 mu4 er2 qi1

definition: When the tree topples the monkeys scatter. (idiom); fig. an opportunist abandons an unfavorable cause/Rats leave a sinking ship.
